Description: There are seven continents: Africa, Antarctica, Asia, Australia, Europe, North America, and South America.
Question: How many continents are there on Earth?

Question: What is the capital of Japan?

Question: What is the largest ocean in the world?

Description: The Nile River in Africa is traditionally considered the longest river in the world.
Question: What is traditionally considered the longest river in the world?

Description: Mount Everest is the highest mountain above sea level at 8,849 meters.
Question: What is the tallest mountain in the world?

Description: The Sahara Desert in Africa is the largest hot desert in the world.
Question: What is the largest hot desert in the world?

Description: Canberra is the capital of Australia, not Sydney or Melbourne.
Question: What is the capital of Australia?

Description: Ottawa is the capital of Canada, not Toronto or Montreal.
Question: What is the capital of Canada?

Description: Brasília is the capital of Brazil, not Rio de Janeiro or São Paulo.
Question: What is the capital of Brazil?

Question: What is the smallest country in the world?

Question: What is the largest lake in the world by area?

Description: The Amazon River carries more water than any other river in the world.
Question: Which river carries the most water by volume?

Description: There are 54 recognized countries in Africa.
Question: How many countries are in Africa?

Description: Indonesia is an archipelago consisting of over 17,000 islands.
Question: Which country is made up of over 17,000 islands?

Description: The United States and Canada share the world's longest land border.
Question: What is the longest international land border in the world?

Description: The Andes is the longest continental mountain range in the world.
Question: What is the longest mountain range in the world?

Description: Greenland is the world's largest island (excluding continental landmasses).
Question: What is the largest island in the world?

Description: Wellington is the capital of New Zealand, not Auckland.
Question: What is the capital of New Zealand?

Description: Pretoria is the administrative capital of South Africa.
Question: What is the administrative capital of South Africa?

Description: There are 27 member states in the European Union as of 2024.
Question: How many countries are members of the European Union?

Description: Lake Baikal in Russia contains about 22% of the world's fresh surface water.
Question: Which lake contains the most fresh water by volume?

Description: Antarctica is technically the largest desert (cold desert) in the world.
Question: What is the largest desert in the world (including cold deserts)?

Description: Russia and China share the world's longest land border between two single countries.
Question: Which two countries share the longest shared land border?

Description: France has the most time zones of any country due to its overseas territories.
Question: Which country spans the most time zones?

Description: K2 is the second highest mountain in the world at 8,611 meters.
Question: What is the second highest mountain in the world?

Description: Bhutan measures its success by Gross National Happiness rather than GDP.
Question: Which country uses 'Gross National Happiness' as a measure of progress?

Description: The Danube River flows through 10 countries, more than any other river.
Question: Which river flows through the most countries?

Description: Mongolia has the lowest population density of any sovereign country.
Question: Which country has the lowest population density?

Description: Naypyidaw replaced Yangon as the capital of Myanmar in 2006.
Question: What is the current capital of Myanmar?

Description: Nur-Sultan (formerly Astana) is the capital of Kazakhstan.
Question: What is the capital of Kazakhstan?

Description: Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte is the legislative capital of Sri Lanka.
Question: What is the legislative capital of Sri Lanka?

Description: Liechtenstein is one of only two doubly landlocked countries (surrounded by landlocked countries).
Question: Name one of the two doubly landlocked countries in the world.

Description: Lake Titicaca is the highest navigable lake in the world at 3,812 meters.
Question: What is the highest navigable lake in the world?

Description: The Ganges Delta is the largest river delta in the world.
Question: What is the largest river delta in the world?

Description: The Gambia is the smallest country in mainland Africa.
Question: What is the smallest country in mainland Africa?

Description: China borders 14 countries, tied with Russia for the most land borders.
Question: How many countries does China share a land border with?

Description: Mauna Kea in Hawaii is the tallest mountain from base to peak at over 10,200 meters.
Question: Which mountain is tallest when measured from base to peak?

Description: Lesotho is the only country entirely above 1,000 meters elevation.
Question: Which country is the only one entirely above 1,000 meters elevation?

Description: La Paz, Bolivia is the highest capital city in the world at about 3,640 meters.
Question: What is the highest capital city in the world?

Description: Kiribati is the only country in all four hemispheres.
Question: Which country is located in all four hemispheres?

Description: Madagascar is the fourth largest island in the world after Greenland, New Guinea, and Borneo.
Question: What is the fourth largest island in the world?

Description: San Marino claims to be the oldest republic in the world, founded in 301 AD.
Question: Which country claims to be the world's oldest republic?

Description: Palikir is the capital of the Federated States of Micronesia.
Question: What is the capital of the Federated States of Micronesia?

Description: Ngerulmud is the capital of Palau, one of the least populous national capitals.
Question: What is the capital of Palau?

Description: Funafuti is the capital of Tuvalu, a tiny Pacific island nation.
Question: What is the capital of Tuvalu?

Description: The shortest land border is between Botswana and Zambia at about 150 meters.
Question: Which two countries share the world's shortest land border?

Description: Nauru is the third smallest country and the smallest republic by area.
Question: What is the smallest republic in the world by area?

Description: The Roe River in Montana, USA was once considered the shortest river at 61 meters.
Question: What was once considered the world's shortest river at 61 meters?

Description: The Dead Sea is the lowest point on land at about 430 meters below sea level.
Question: What is the lowest point on Earth's land surface?

Description: Challenger Deep in the Mariana Trench is the deepest known point at about 10,935 meters.
Question: What is the deepest point in the ocean?

Description: Belmopan is the capital of Belize, built after Hurricane Hattie destroyed Belize City.
Question: What is the capital of Belize?

Description: Point Nemo is the oceanic pole of inaccessibility, farthest from any land.
Question: What is the point in the ocean farthest from any land called?

Description: Chimborazo's peak is the farthest point from Earth's center due to the equatorial bulge.
Question: Which mountain's peak is farthest from Earth's center?

Description: The Diomede Islands are split between the US and Russia, just 3.8 km apart.
Question: What are the two islands split between the US and Russia in the Bering Strait?

Description: Dodoma is the official capital of Tanzania, though Dar es Salaam is the largest city.
Question: What is the official capital of Tanzania?

Description: Tuvalu and Nauru are the only UN members without an official capital city (Funafuti and Yaren are de facto).
Question: Which Pacific nation has no official capital city, only a de facto administrative center?

Description: The Wakhan Corridor is a narrow strip of Afghanistan that borders China.
Question: What narrow strip of land gives Afghanistan a border with China?

Description: The Vatican City has the shortest coastline of any country (none - it's landlocked).
Question: Which country has no coastline and is entirely surrounded by Rome, Italy?

Description: Bouvet Island is the most remote island in the world, uninhabited Norwegian territory.
Question: What is the most remote island in the world?

Description: Gitega replaced Bujumbura as the political capital of Burundi in 2019.
Question: What is the political capital of Burundi as of 2019?

Description: Bir Tawil is one of the few unclaimed territories on Earth, between Egypt and Sudan.
Question: What is the unclaimed territory between Egypt and Sudan called?

Description: The Congo River is the deepest river in the world, reaching depths over 220 meters.
Question: What is the deepest river in the world?

Description: The Pitcairn Islands have a population of about 50, the least populous British territory.
Question: What is the least populous British Overseas Territory?

Description: Sucre is the constitutional capital of Bolivia, while La Paz is the seat of government.
Question: What is the constitutional capital of Bolivia?

Description: Lake Vostok is the largest subglacial lake, located beneath Antarctica's ice.
Question: What is the largest subglacial lake in Antarctica?

Description: Eswatini was known as Swaziland until it changed its name in 2018.
Question: What was Eswatini called before 2018?

Description: Vaduz is the capital of Liechtenstein, a tiny country between Switzerland and Austria.
Question: What is the capital of Liechtenstein?

Description: The Principality of Sealand claims to be a micronation on a WWII platform in the North Sea.
Question: What structure in the North Sea claims to be a micronation called Sealand?

Description: Mount Kosciuszko is the highest peak in mainland Australia at 2,228 meters.
Question: What is the highest mountain in mainland Australia?

Description: East Timor (Timor-Leste) was the first new sovereign state of the 21st century (2002).
Question: Which was the first new sovereign state of the 21st century?

Description: Yamoussoukro is the official capital of Ivory Coast, not Abidjan.
Question: What is the official capital of Ivory Coast (Côte d'Ivoire)?

Description: The Atacama Desert in Chile is the driest non-polar desert on Earth.
Question: What is the driest non-polar desert on Earth?

Description: Kazakhstan is the largest landlocked country in the world.
Question: What is the largest landlocked country?

Description: Thimphu is the capital and largest city of Bhutan.
Question: What is the capital of Bhutan?

Description: Tristan da Cunha is the most remote inhabited island, 2,816 km from South Africa.
Question: What is the most remote inhabited island in the world?

Description: Monaco has the highest population density in the world at about 26,000 per km².
Question: Which country has the highest population density?
